intro: Siphonodon membranaceus, commonly known as the membranous siphon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, membranous leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in riverine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its aesthetic appeal.
